main_definition: Replacement refers to the act of substituting one thing, person, or object with another that serves a similar purpose or function.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The process of changing something old or worn-out for new
meanings_and_examples.example: When our car broke down, we had to find a replacement.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A person who takes the place of another in an organization, role, or position
meanings_and_examples.example: After her resignation, John was appointed as the new manager, replacing his predecessor.

meanings_and_examples.definition: An object that serves the same function as the one it replaces
meanings_and_examples.example: In my kitchen, I use a blender to replace the hand mixer for making smoothies.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A substitute in sports or games due to injury or absence of an original player
meanings_and_examples.example: The injured striker was replaced by his teammate during the soccer match.

meanings_and_examples.definition: To replace a lost item with another that is similar but not identical
meanings_and_examples.example: After losing her necklace, she got a replacement piece of jewelry from her friend.
